definition[0]: to reduce the influence or power of a law, system, government etc
example[0]: a threat to roll back the legislation of the past 12 years
definition[1]: to reduce a price, cost etc
example[1]: the administration’s promise to roll back taxes
definition[2]: to force your opponents in a war to move back from their position
definition[3]: to make someone remember something from the past
example[2]: Looking at those old photos really rolled back the years.
definition[4]: to reduce the price of something to a previous level
